action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: The image shows a landscape with a horse walking on a grassy field. In the background, there are trees and mountains under a partly cloudy sky. The horse has a light-colored mane and tail.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A brown horse with a light mane is walking on a grassy field. In the background, there are trees and mountains under a cloudy sky.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The image shows a landscape with a horse walking on a grassy field. In the background, there are trees and mountains under a partly cloudy sky. The horse has a light-colored mane and tail.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there any text or signature visible in your image?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A brown horse with a light mane is walking on a grassy field. In the background, there are trees and mountains under a cloudy sky.
QUESTION: Is there any text or signature visible in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any rocks visible on the grassy field in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Are there any rocks visible on the grassy field in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the horse in your image positioned towards the left, center, or right side of the image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is the horse in your image positioned towards the left, center, or right side of the image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any bushes or shrubs visible in the grassy field in your image?

ANSWER: Left.
QUESTION: Are there any bushes or shrubs visible in the grassy field in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the sky in your image mostly clear, partly cloudy, or very cloudy?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is the sky in your image mostly clear, partly cloudy, or very cloudy? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any other animals visible in your image besides the horse?

ANSWER: Partly cloudy.
QUESTION: Are there any other animals visible in your image besides the horse? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.

ANSWER: No.
